title: Favorite Ski Resorts
name: Favorite Ski Resorts
description:
A Map by Alukanic

This map shows the top ten winter ski resorts that I have visited throughout my lifetime.

properties.name: Aspen, CO
properties.description: Posted by AlukanicAspen is an awesome place to ski, as well as relax, for a vacation. It is located a ways away from most of the other Colorado ski resorts but it\'s proximity to the airport and ski in/ski out access is outstanding.

properties.name: Beaver Creek
properties.description: Posted by Alukanic311 Offerson Rd, Avon, COBeaver Creek is an upscale resort that covers four mountains. It is very easy to get lost or become seperated with your party, because of the size of the resort.

properties.name: Boyne Mountain
properties.description: Posted by AlukanicBoyne Mountain is just a little playground compared to the gigantic resorts out west. It is about a 6 hour drive from where I live, Chicago. A long weekend is all you need to see Boyne Mountain due to its relatively small size. There is great golfing here in the summer.

properties.name: Breckenridge
properties.description: Posted by AlukanicBreckenridge, COI visited Breckenridge in March of 2006. The ski resort is very large with over 100 ski runs that are suitable for everyone. The village at the base of the mountain offered tons of night time entertainment, as well as an ice skating facility.

properties.name: Copper Mountain
properties.description: Posted by Alukaniccopper mountain, coCopper Mountain was the first ski resort I ever visited and it is still one of my favorites. The mountain isn\'t as large and doesn\'t have as many runs but the night skiing and the mid-mountain bar do more than make up for it\'s lack of size.

properties.name: Deer Valley
properties.description: Posted by AlukanicDeer Valley is a very upscale ski resort located in the town of Park City, Utah. The resort does not allow snowboarders and some of the ski runs were the sites of the 2002 Winter Olympic Games.

properties.name: Park City Mountain Resort
properties.description: Posted by Alukanic1310 Lowell Ave, Park City, UTPark City Mountain Resort is a great place for the whole family. It is only 30 minutes from the Salt Lake City airport and because the altitude isn\'t as extreme as in Colorado, altitude sickness is not an issue.

properties.name: Snowbird
properties.description: Posted by AlukanicSnowbird, UtahSnowbird is by far the most challenging ski resort that I have visited. The back bowls are very steep and the majority of the ski runs are for the advanced skier.

properties.name: Vail, CO
properties.description: Posted by AlukanicVail is in my top five favorite places to ski. It has unbelievable back bowls and the snow always seems to be perfect when I am there. The village at the base of the resort is known for its shops and restaurants.

properties.name: Winter Park
properties.description: Posted by AlukanicWinter Par is a resort for the more advanced skier. The runs are very steep and when I was there the snow was not as good as I would have liked. If you\'re looking for a challenge, go the Winter Park.
